In this paragraph, the two disease entities mentioned are "disabled" and "lymphoproliferative disorder". "Disabled" is a general term that can refer to a wide range of conditions that limit a person's ability to carry out daily activities. However, in this context, it is used to describe the patients' physical status. "Lymphoproliferative disorder" is a more specific medical term that refers to a group of diseases characterized by the excessive proliferation of lymphocytes, a type of white blood cell that plays a crucial role in the immune system.
